Forex Broker License in Hong Kong

Regulation of the forex broker companies in Hong Kong

The Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong, aka the Hong Kong SFC, is the regulatory body responsible for all administrative, regulatory and supervisory practices of Hong Kong broker companies. In order to obtain a Hong Kong forex broker license, all applications must be submitted to the SFC.

Applying for a Forex Broker License with the SFC Hong Kong

You must register a Hong Kong company with forex broker activities in order to obtain a Hong Kong forex broker license. An application for a license involves the filing of the documents such as the Memorandum and Articles of Association, as well as the company's management for internal and external procedures, company policies. You should also provide the results of the Due Diligence and KYC procedures.

The applying procedure for obtaining a forex broker license in Hong Kong is long and complicated. For a positive result of a license obtaining, it is necessary to follow all established procedures and provide all documents requested by the Hong Kong SFC.

Types of licenses in Hong Kong

There are the necessary information below about obtaining a Hong Kong Securities and Finance Ordinance (SFO) license. The following activities are considered as the regulated activities that require licensing in HK:

  • Type 1 – Dealing in Securities
  • Type 2 – Dealing in Futures Contracts
  • Type 3 – Leveraged Foreign Exchange Trading
  • Type 4 – Advising on Securities
  • Type 5 – Advising on Futures Contracts
  • Type 6 – Advising on Corporate Finance
  • Type 7 – Providing Automated Trading Services
  • Type 8 – Securities Margin Financing
  • Type 9 – Asset Management
Share capital requirements for a Hong Kong forex broker license obtaining

Based on the fact that the forex broker activity will be limited only to the foreign exchange trading (type 3), such a company must keep a paid-in share capital and Liquid capital of at least HKD 5,000,000 and Liquid capital must be no less than HKD 3,000,000.

“Liquid capital” is defined as “the sum, the part of the liquid assets of which exceeds the amount of its liabilities”.

Requirements to staff for obtaining a Hong Kong Forex Broker License

In the case of applying for a Hong Kong forex broker license, at least two responsible officials of the applicant must be engaged in regulated activities, the company is licensed for (activity of a forex broker is regulated only by a license of type 3, thus only 2 responsible officials (RO) are required.

One of the responsible officials must operate as the chief executive of the company. Both responsible officials must have a representative license for the regulated activity.

The regulator will check whether the proposed specialists have appropriate abilities, skills, knowledge and experience to manage and control the company's business effectively in relation to regulated activities.

Costs of a license for a forex broker obtaining in Hong Kong

As for a forex broker license in this jurisdiction, the Acalista group charges fees at hourly rates. The type 3 license application is assumed and include the following steps:

  • Preparation, submission, modification of the license forms (for a company and for the responsible officials – RO),
  • Drawing up a business plan,
  • Preparation of agreements,
  • Preparation of materials for the AML and KYC procedures,
  • Preparation of other materials at the regulator request,
  • Holding meetings, conferences and communication sessions with clients,
  • Answering queries and communicating with the SFC
  • Registration of a company in Hong Kong

Forex Broker License in Estonia

If a forex broker has a forex broker license, it is the main criterion in choosing a forex broker by traders. Licenses show which regulator controls the company quality and activities.

Estonia is an excellent jurisdiction for a forex license obtaining due to the fact that Estonia is a respected jurisdiction in the EU. Also, Estonian state authorities are loyal to this type of activity if all legal procedures and requirements are met.

According to the Estonian legislation, the forex broker services are classified as “investment services”. Legal entities operating as a Forex broker need to obtain a special EFSA license, that is regulated by the Estonian Securities Market Act, as well as within the EU — MIFID — the EU Markets in Financial Instruments Directive.

EFSA license — a forex broker license in Estonia

The EFSA is the licensing authority for legal entities that are registered in Estonia, have a registered office in Estonia and are operating in Estonia.

The activity that is subject to licensing is the securities trading, and there may also be other services that are related to securities; Forex broker services, as well as electronic money services, require an investment license. In order to obtain an EFSA license, you do not need to get a FIU certificate.

Based on the Estonian Securities Market Act, the term “securities” includes:
  • shares or other equivalent rights that are in turnover;
  • IOUs, convertible securities, other promissory notes that have been issued and are in the turnover and are not a money market instrument;
  • rights to purchase the securities;
  • a share in an investment fund;
  • a money market instrument;
  • a derivative security or derivative contract;
  • a turnover certificate of a security depositing.

In order to comply with a license, a legal entity must be registered as a Limited Liability Company in Estonia.

The directors of any regulated legal entity must meet certain criteria – have a proper higher education and work experience in this area (a CV, diplomas of education should be provided), as well as a good reputation (no bankruptcy cases, revocation of licenses, convictions, etc.).

Founders, who take a significant part in the company management, must also have an appropriate business reputation and have no criminal offenses. Also, the EFSA will check the financial situation of shareholders.

General organizational requirements for staff

The hired staff should have enough skills, experience and competence to fulfil the professional or official duties;

According to the law, an appropriate official is:

  • a forex company manager and forex agent;
  • a forex agent manager of a forex company;
  • an officer of a forex company and its forex agent who is involved in the provision of investment or ancillary services or carrying out the investment transactions;
  • an individual who is involved in providing of services to a forex company that are under the control of a forex company or its forex agent;
  • an individual who provides the services to a forex company or its forex agent under agreement of transfering the operations.

According to the Estonian Securities Market Act, there are some requirements for the authorized capital for a forex broker license obtaining:

1) 50,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • taking and transmission of orders related to securities;
  • the orders implementation, related to securities, on behalf of the client;

2) 125,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • portfolio management;
  • organization of securities offer or issue;
  • safekeeping and management of securities for the client, as well as related activities, including the securities transfer and pledge and other actions related to the encumbrance of clients' securities and transfers for execution;

3) 730,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • transactions with securities at own expense;
  • securities ensuring or guaranteeing of its offer, issue or sale;

In each specific case, it is necessary to provide confirmation of the source of funds.

For obtaining a STP license, you need to contribute a share capital of 125,000 euros, for a Market Maker license – 730,000 euros.

After a forex broker license is obtained, a legal entity is able to carry out the certification of its activities in any Eurozone country.

It requires submition of the appropriate set of documents to the Supervision Authority, that includes: the name of the state where he is going to operate, a business plan with detailed description of the activities and services with translation of the necessary documents certified by a sworn translator.

Managers of a Forex broker company

Only a person who have a university degree, experience and necessary professional qualifications to run a forex company and have an impeccable reputation can be elected or appointed as a head of forex company.

Forex company management must consist of at least two people.

Members of the board of a forex company must have completed higher education or an equivalent education, as well as necessary experience to run such a company.

In order to apply for an EFSA license, you must provide the following documents and information (some of them may relate to an existing company but not to a just established entity):

  • Memorandum or Resolution;
  • Articles of association
  • A document confirming the paid-up share capital;
  • A List of shareholders (with defining of their parts);
  • Information about the shareholders of the managing holding (if they exist);
  • Information about members of the board of directors and management (with detailed description);
  • Information about companies where the applicant or manager holds 20 or more percent of the shares (with detailed description);
  • Information about the applicant's auditor and persons conducting an internal control (with detailed description);
  • Financial information (a balance sheet, an income statement, annual reports if a company has been working);
  • Documents confirming the amount of the own capital with the auditor's report;
  • In the case of a holding ownership — a certificate issued by the supervisory authority of the relevant state is required, if the holding is owned by a foreign entity that is a subject of financial supervision. This certificate confirms that the defined foreign company has a valid license to operate;
    And, according to the supervisory authority, its activities do not contradict the current legislation;
  • A business plan;
  • Information about IT systems;
  • Description of the organizational structure;
  • Accounting policies and procedures;
  • The AML rules;
  • Other internal rules that are relevant to all regulated entities or specific services;

The EFSA inspection, application and review process takes approximately 6 months.

The cost of our company's services for the preparation and submission of a complete set of documents, including applications, internal rules, policies, other documents that are previously agreed for a license obtaining, participation in collection of all necessary documents, is from 20,000 Euro.

In the case of additional services, such as lengthy discussions on the business compliance with Estonian regulation, additional proceedings with EFSA (preparation of responses to their additional requestes, participation in meetings), an additional fee will be charged at hourly rates.

Forex Broker License in the Czech Republic

According to the Czech Republic legislation, the forex broker services are classified as “investment services”. Companies, operating as a Forex broker, need to obtain a special EFSA license, that is regulated by the Czech Republic Securities Market Act, that is regulated by the MIFID — the EU Markets in Financial Instruments Directive.

The Authorized capital Requirements for a forex broker license in the Czech Republic

1) 125,000 euros if the company provides the following services (a STP license):

  • portfolio management;
  • organization of securities offer or issue;
  • safekeeping and management of securities for the client, as well as related activities, including securities transfer and pledge and other actions related to the encumbrance of clients' securities and transfers for execution;

2) 730,000 euros if the company provides the following services (a Market Maker license):

  • transactions with securities at own expense;
  • securities ensuring or guaranteeing of its offer, issue or sale;
  • In each specific case, it is necessary to provide confirmation of the source of funds.

Also, there should be at least 2 board members with sufficient qualifications and education.

General organizational requirements to a staff

Founders of a forex broker company, who own 10% of its shares or more, should meet high qualifications and necessary knowledge in the investment services, as well as have experience of running a broker company.

The company employees must have sufficient skills, experience and competence to do the professional or official duties;

Forex company managers

Only a person who have a university degree, experience and necessary professional qualifications to run a forex company and have an impeccable reputation can be appointed as a forex company head.

The leadership of a forex company must consist of at least two members.

Members of board of a forex company must have completed higher education or an equivalent education, as well as a necessary experience to run such a company.

According to the law, an appropriate official is:

  • a forex company manager and forex agent;
  • a forex agent manager of a forex company;
  • an officer of a forex company and its forex agent who is involved in providing of investment or ancillary services or carrying out the investment transactions;
  • an individual who is involved in the provision of services to a forex company that are under the control of a forex company or its forex agent;
  • an individual who provides the services to a forex company or its forex agent under the agreement of operations transfer.
The price includes:
  • Registration of a company in the Czech Republic (local services are possible);
  • Drawing up and submitting the application for a license to the Czech National Bank;
  • Preparation of the appropriate company structure;
  • Drawing up a business plan for the company;
  • Preparation of the necessary manuals;
  • Preparation of the necessary company policies to be posted on the company's website;
  • Search for the suitable specialists in the Czech Republic who meet the criteria for a license obtaining;
  • Preparing of responses to additional inquiries from the Czech National Bank;
  • Preparation of the letters that accompany the application, if there are additional questions from the Czech National Bank;
  • Support the client in providing all the necessary documentation and information;
  • Opening a bank account of a company for forex activities;
  • Integration of a merchant account to the company's website.
Requirements for a place of a forex broker company
A company that has received a forex license in the Czech Republic must have an operating office in the Czech Republic.
A company that obtains a forex license should not have any subsidiaries, except ones that carry out the same investment activities.
License
validity
After a forex broker license is recieved in the Czech Republic, the company can further operate as a forex broker in other EU countries, having passed a simple certification procedure.
Timelines of a license obtaining
from 6 to 9 months (including preparation of documents)

Forex Broker License in Cape Verde

Cape Verde – Republic of Cape Verde – is a state in West Africa

Population is 520,502 people

Income level – below average

Capital – Praia

Further, there are a detailed information about the main steps of registering a business and obtaining a forex broker license in Cape Verde. The information includes the procedures, timelines and cost of starting a business and obtaining a license for a commercial enterprise.

  • Legal form: Sociedade por Quotas de Responsabilidade Limitada (LDA)
  • Paid up minimum share capital: 1 CVE
  • The city: Praia
Municipal license obtaining

Agency: The Municipality

There are two types of licenses in Cape Verde: a municipal license and an activity license. A municipal license is compulsory for all businesses that are operating in Praia. An inspection is usually carried out before the granting of a municipal license.

However, since the Decreto-Lei of 30/2009 has been adopted, an inspection of the municipality can be carried out a posteriori and an enterprise can start its activities before receiving the municipal license.

The license can be checked online through the following web portal:
lojacmp.com

A license obtaining – 8 days

An official duty – about 400 USD

An activity license, as the name implies, is obtained for the activity that the company is going to carry out. This license is optional for all companies. For example, if a commercial company does not conduct the export-import activities, there is no need to obtain such a license.

If a company applies for two licenses at once, the inspection of the Municipality is carried out by two inspectors.

A company name verification and reservation
Agency: The Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão)
Investors provide a proposed company name and activities. The verification is carried out by the Department of Trade Registry (Casa Do cidadão), that approves or rejects the names. The registry is computerized, so the verification process is very fast.
The Process – 1 day
Registration
of a company
Agency: The Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão)
After the authorized person goes to the Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão), the company is registered through the internal online registration form. The company incorporation notice is published on the Casa do Cidadão website. A company tax number is assigned automatically and free of charge.
The Process – 1 day
The Registration duty – about 200 USD
Making a deposit of the authorized capital to the bank
Agency: The Commercial Bank of Cape Verde
In practice, The Casa Do cidadão requires that founders make a deposit within two days of registration.
For companies that are not registered using the “Empresa no Dia” fast registration method, the minimum authorized capital is deposited to the bank before registration.
The Process – 1 day

Currency regime in Cape Verde

  • The Foreign Exchange Regulation (“Forex”) rules apply to all transactions between Forex residents and Forex non-residents, regardless of their nature (personal or business transactions).
  • Foreign currency transfers between a resident and non-resident company are subject to a Forex license, that varies depending on the types of transactions.
  • Forex transactions must be carried out through the local banks or financial institutions authorized to fulfil such transactions.
Registration of employees at the Social Security Directorate (Instituto nacional de previdência social)
Agency: The Social Security Agency (Instituto Nacional de Previdência)
Employee registration for an accident insurance
Agency: An Insurance company
The founders must insure workers against the accidents with any insurance company.
Timeline – 1 day
Registration of workers
in the labor inspectorate
Agency: The Labor Inspection
This procedure is mandatory if the company hires employees under an employment contract.
Timeline – 1 day
Receiving and processing of company's books
Agency: The Labor Inspection
Agency: The National Press (Imprensa Nacional)
These books can be purchased at the Imprensa Nacional. All pages must be signed by an authorized person.

***The last three points are carried out simultaneously with a license obtaining.

The Forex operations:
  • Opening of resident offshore bank account — Pre-approval
  • Payment for goods, current transactions and invisible elements of trading operations — Free
  • Capital Transactions — Pre-approval
  • Other Operations — Pre-approval

The Cape Verdean jurisdiction has just recently got popularity for many licensed activities, including the forex activities.

The companies that provide forex, payment systems, cryptocurrencies, financial and gambling services can get benefit from a license obtaining to establish a business in this jurisdiction.

Forex Broker License in Australia

Forex brokers activities in Australia are regulated by the Corporations Act, 2001 and are considered as a subtype of the OTC contracts. Accordingly, buying and selling in the forex online market is also considered as a financial activity that can only be carried out in Australia with a special license.

Under the Corporations Act, the financial services companies must be incorporated and licensed in Australia.

Therefore, the activities of companies connected with the forex market are subject to be licensed.

In Australia, the forex companies are considered as the companies that provide financial services and are required to obtain an appropriate license, that indicates the services the company can provide.

The Section 3 of Part 7 of the Corporations Act contains a definition and list of financial services, according to which the financial services, listed in Section 4 of Part 4 of that Act, may be provided.

Providing of the financial services by a forex company to retail clients requires meeting all commitments to protect the interests of such clients. The Commission pays special attention to this fact in the case of making a decision to issue a license.

Timelines of obtaining a forex broker license in Australia
  • The application meets all legal requirements;
  • The applicant is able to ensure compliance with all the obligations that the license and legislation impose on him;
  • The applicant has the appropriate operating rules and procedures to ensure proper providing of financial services;
  • The applicant has concluded all the necessary agreements, treaties and contracts, that are essential for providing the proper financial services;
  • The applicant's managers and staff meet all the criteria that the commission sets for their education, knowledge and experience.
Fees
  • A Fee for license application review (one-time) is USD 1,485
  • A Fee for amending the terms of a valid license is USD 249
  • A Financial Reporting Fee is USD 549
  • A Fee for Notice of an Auditor Appointment is USD 36
  • An Annual license fee USD 1,086
The procedure for obtaining a Forex broker license in Australia

Filling out the forms of all founders, managers and key employees of the enterprise, as well as the necessary documentation confirming the powers of the persons, their experience and business knowledge; Filling of the FS01 application and accompanying papers.

In the application form, the person should choose the financial products, as well as the types of financial services that he intends to provide in relation to such products.

The applicant must also submit to the Commission the comprehensive evidence that confirms: the sufficient competence of his employees, a large amount of financial resources, as well as the commitment to ensuring all the license terms and all the legislation and the Commission requirements.

Inter alia, the Internal regulations and policies (for example, an anti-money laundering, a risk management, compliance with a license and legislation, etc.).

  • The Commission is entitled to require the applicant to provide any information and documents that it considers necessary;
  • A Business plan preparation;
  • At least 2 resident managers and an employee, who will oversee the compliance with all license conditions and legal requirements by the legal entity, should be appointed;
  • Submission of the documents to the regulator;
  • After the regulator's confirmation, it is necessary to make the insurance policies for liability to the Company's clients;
  • After all terms, indicated by the Commission in the preliminary decision of a license issuance, are met in the established timelines, the company will receive a license and can start its activities;
  • It is required to appoint an auditor and notify the Commission about it within a month.
The licensing authority control over the forex broker company activities in Australia

The Commission constantly monitors the Company activities, as well as controls its compliance with all license conditions and legal requirements.

A company that is considered as "a small" by the Australian legislation is required to submit the financial statements to the Commission within 1 month after the end of financial year and the audited financial statements with an independent auditor's conclusion within 3 months after the end of financial year.

A financial services company is considered as "a small" if it meets two or more of the following criteria:

  • The company's net assets do not exceed USD 5,000,000;
  • The company's gross income does not exceed USD 5,000,000;
  • A total number of employees does not exceed 20 people.

In other cases, the company is considered as medium or large and is required to submit financial statements to the Commission within 2 months after the end of financial year and the audited financial statements with an independent auditor conclusion within 4 months after the end of financial year.

The reasons for suspension and /or revocation of a forex broker license in Australia

The legislation imposes a clear list of the reasons for suspension and / or revocation of a license, particularly for:

  • violation of the laws, established regulation, the same in the case of submission the false information to the Commission;
  • non-compliance with the requirements of the Commission;
  • suspension or breaking off the financial services providing by the license holder for more than 6 months;
  • non-payment of the state fees.
Customer service
of a forex broker company in Australia
Running business with the US residents is strictly prohibited. As for other regions, there are no legal restrictions.
However, a forex company, licensed by the Commission, must obtain its permission to operate on the territory of other states.
Customer Complaints
Procedure
The legislation set out that all customer complaints must be reviewed by the company (or an assigned employee), and the results of the complaint must be reported to the customer in a written form.
Futhermore, the company must have an internal regulation that describes in details the procedure for resolution of the disputes with customers.
The Company should inform all private clients of their right to make complaints against the Company to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
Requirements
for the shareholders
The general requirement for shareholders of a forex company is knowledge of this type of financial services and being able to maintain the financial resources and assets of the company at any time, at least at the minimum required level.
According to the license obtaining practice, the Commission requires at least one shareholder of a forex company has experience in regulating a forex company in Australia or another jurisdiction for no less than 3 out of the last 5 years.
There are no legal requirements for the authorized capital

A Forex broker must keep the physical assets:

since January 31, 2014 – 10% of the annual income, but not less than USD 1,000,000, if the forex broker is not a dealing center;

5% of the annual income, but not less than USD 10,000,000 if the forex broker is a dealing center.

The company must have at least two Australian resident directors throughout the license period, an employee who will control the Company's compliance with all license conditions, the Commission and legal requirements, as well as a sufficient number of employees to provide the quality financial services.

The company should have a physical office in Australia. Using of the shell companies is prohibited.

The legislation contains special requirements for any information, including advertising, shared by a company. Thereby, a forex company must ensure that the information it shares is accurate and does not mislead the customers.

Penalties of a Forex broker in Australia

The Australian legislation does not contain a complete list of sanctions that the Commission and other regulatory authorities apply to the violators of the license terms and legislation of the forex company activities.

According to the legislation, the Commission has extensive powers in the choice of sanctions, that include administrative, civil and criminal liability, depending on the gravity of the offence and its consequences.

In the case of choosing the type of liability, the Commission pursues the following goals: a punishment of the offender and protection of the investor interests and his assets.

The Commission applies a wide range of measures to punish the offenders, that can include criminal liability in the form of imprisonment or community service for the serious misdeeds, and the civil or administrative penalties in the form of fines for less serious offenses.

Based on the investigation results, the Commission can independently determine the penalties level that apply to the company and its management, due to many factors. The minimum fine is USD 550 (for example, for the late submission of a financial report or notice to the Commission, required by law).

For a major offenses, the Commission, at its discretion, has the right to impose sanction to a forex company in the form of license revocation, as well as to impose fines up to USD 495,000 or thriple amount of the received benefit.

Moreover, the guilty company's official can be imprisoned for up to 10 years. The company's license may be revoked if the Commission has reasonable suspicions about the business reputation impeccability of any employees.

Advertisement
of the Forex Broker Services in Australia
The legislation states that a forex company can share the advertising information only after a license for this type of activity is obtained.
The price of services
for obtaining a forex broker license in Australia
The price of services for obtaining a forex broker license in Australia depends on the amount of the time spent by the specialists of the Acalista group.
The cost of forms submission and a license support can range from USD 22,000 to USD 45,000.

  • no income taxes;
  • no capital gains taxes;
  • no inheritance taxes.

Therefore, the forex and binary options companies are not the only ones that are interested in a company establishing in this jurisdiction.

As far as the forex and binary options are highly controled in the most jurisdictions, with the few exceptions, a forex licensed company has a great advantage over the other companies as it has more trust among the traders and improves their reputation.

Many issues are solved, such as opening a bank account with a reliable bank, the processing companies and acquiring banks will be more disposed to offer a lower commission percentage on company payments, considering the operations of a licensed company to be less risky than companies without a license.

Also, it will be much easier for a company with a license in Vanuatu to obtain a financial license in European jurisdiction in the future.

Cryptoexchange license in Singapore

Cryptocurrency exchange in Singapore. In recent years, Singapore has been one of the countries with the largest financial investments in the cryptocurrency market. This is due to the fact that the Singaporean legislation is one of the most loyal to the virtual currencies business.

Legal position of the authorities

Over the recent years, the cryptocurrency exchanges development in Singapore has intensified. Therefore, the Singapore Monetary and Financial Authority (MAS) was forced to express its position on this matter many times, as well as to explain some legal rules.

The MAS was loyal to the companies that deal just with the exchange of virtual currencies, since their activities can be carried out without a government licensing in Singapore.

At the same time, the companies that have conducted the ICOs and are involved in transactions with securities (most often with the digital tokens) are required to obtain an appropriate Singapore license, since the sphere of securities circulation is clearly regulated in Singapore by a special regulation.

So, as long as the activities of the intermediary company in Singapore do not treat with the securities market, but just exchange the virtual currencies, no licenses are required. Such attitude of financial management attracts cryptocurrency entrepreneurs from various countries.

Token as a security

A token is not always equated to securities, and therefore, the rules of the securities exchange do not always apply to its sale. However, in order to operate legally, it is important to know in what cases digital tokens act as securities.

The token is distributed to attract loans. In this case, the digital tokens are prove of the company debt that put the tokens to their holders. The token is an equivalent to a loan.

Digital markers are placed on the platform to attract investors. The holders of tokens are able to participate in the company management, as well as to get profits from its activities. In this case, the token is equated to shares.

These examples are the most common, but this list can be updated.

The main requirements for licensing of activities in Singapore

A licensing is a rather grave procedure. That is why a token trading company that want to license its activities in Singapore must meet a number of requirements:

  • a high level of security (it is necessary to ensure a full security of a platform from the unauthorized intrusions and funds secure);
  • should comply with the exchange rules for transparent admission to the trading;
  • an exact accounting of all operations, carried out on the platform;
  • do not commit any actions that violate the rights of platform users, but also create conditions for the confidential information;
  • record the violations of the law and report to the authorized bodies;
  • it is important to have an established risk-management system.
Criteria for a trustworthy cryptocurrency exchanger

A virtual currency exchange company must have a specific staff. The staff is headed by a general director, a chairman, board of directors.

For their part, the board of directors has a structured system consisting of various committees. Each of the committees is responsible for a specific area, for example, the staff appointments, the salary, the audits.

It is important to keep up

First of all, the cryptocurrency exchanges activities in Singapore must comply with regulations of fighting against an illegal money laundering, as well as financing of the terrorist organizations. Consequently, the token issuers are responsible for identifying the platform users.

إبدأ اليوم
Cryptocurrency license in the USA

Since the Money Laundering Control Act, 1994 was passed, the MSBs (Money Services Business) have to be registered with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) of the United States Department of the Treasury on a biennial basis.

In 2001, in an attempt to cope with the terrorist financing, the US Patriots Act expanded a federal regulation of the MSB, considered it as a federal crime to run a money transfer business without a money transfer license in any state that required such a license.

The court imposed an order to expand the concept of money transfer to include not only “a transfer of the actual money or currency”, but also “a transfer of the value of this currency through any other exchanger”.

The invention of Bitcoin in 2009 and a large number of the blockchain-based alternative cryptocurrencies have expanded both the benefits of these assets and the criminal interest for its using. In response, the FinCEN issued an explanatory guide for the virtual currency exchanges (the “FinCEN Guide”) on March 18, 2013.

The aim of the FinCEN Guidelines was “to explain the applicability of the rules implementation by the BSA (Bank Secrecy Act) to persons that create, receive, distribute, exchange, accept or transfer virtual currencies”. It pointed two categories of participants in the cryptocurrency industry: "exchangers" and "administrators".

Exchanger —

is a person or organization "engaged in the business of exchanging the virtual currency for the real currency, funds, or other virtual currency." A virtual currency administrator is a person or organization "engaged in business for issuance the virtual currency (putting into circulation) and has the right to buy back (withdrawn from circulation) such virtual currency."

The FinCEN's management concluded that the definition of a money transmitter does not distinguish the “real” and “virtual” currencies, “The acceptance and transmission of any value things in place of the currency, makes a person the money transmitter in accordance with the BSA regulations.”

Therefore, the exchangers and administrators are money transmitters that must be registered as the MSBs (unless they fall into the exception).

As the registered MSBs, these businesses are subject to the certain additional requirements under the BSA and its executive rules and must develop the safe anti-money laundering (“AML”) programs.

The federal government currently relies on powers under the 18 U.S.C. §1960 and the FinCEN guidance to monitor the cryptocurrency projects that are illegal.

Over the past two years, an increasing number of criminal complaints have been filed against the operation of unlicensed cryptocurrency MSBs in violation of the 1960 section. The Justice Department has started the cases in the states of Arizona, Colorado, Maine, Missouri, New York and Ohio.

Cryptocurrency license in Malta

In order to apply for a license, the applicant must be a legal entity registered in Malta. If you just offer the investment advice services, an applicant may be a natural person residing in Malta. There should be at least 2 directors / managers in the company to fulfill the principle of "double control".

A System auditor

The MFSA may require the client to appoint a system auditor, as well as a system auditor to be in place at any time, even after a license is obrained. The system auditor is appointed / replaced subject to the prior approval from the MFSA.

The SA reviews / verifies client's DLT technology, makes an audit report and submits the copy to the MFSA. The MFSA may ask another SA to review / verify the DLT at any time.

The Services – Cryptocurrency License in Malta

The following VFA services require licenses for a DLT that has been identified as a virtual financial asset:

  • Taking and transmission of the orders: Receiving the orders for purchase, sale or subscription for the virtual financial assets and transfer the order to a third party to use.
  • Execution of the orders on behalf of others: entering into agreements to buy, sell or subscribe for the virtual financial assets on behalf of others.
  • Self-account: trading with equity, leading to transactions in the virtual financial assets.
  • Portfolio management: the management of assets owned by another person, if these assets include the virtual financial assets or their management mechanisms allow the person, who manages or agrees to manage these assets, has a right to invest any of these assets in the virtual financial assets. The term “assets” excludes any financial instrument, whether they are issued in Malta or not.
  • A Custodian or Local Services: (a) acting as a custodian or a local holder of the virtual financial asset and /or a secret key; or (b) having a virtual financial asset and /or a private cryptographic key as a local representative, if the person, acting as the local, performs the activities on behalf of another person who provides any VFA service on behalf of that person's client, and such a local holding is carried out in relation to this service.
  • Board of Investment: Providing, offering or concent to provide the investors or potential investors or the investor agents or potential investor with a personal recommendation in relation to one or more transactions with the virtual financial assets.
  • Virtual Financial Asset Offering: Marketing of re-issued virtual financial assets or virtual financial assets that have already been issued but are not admitted to trading on the DLT exchange, to the special entities and that are not connected with the offering to the public or the existing owners of the issuer's virtual financial assets.
  • VFA exchange operation.
Classes of licenses – the MFSA has the power to define the category the applicant party applies for

VFAA Class 1

  • Receiving and transferring the VFA orders; and / or
  • Providing an investment advice in terms of the VFA; and / or
  • VFA location

VFAA Class 2

  • Providing of any VFA services and holding or control of the clients' money, except for the VFA exchange operations or conduction of the personal account

VFAA Class 3

  • Providing of any VFA services and holding or control of clients' money, except for the VFA exchange operations

VFAA Class 4 – VFA Exchange

  • VFA Exchange Management;
  • Holding or managing of the client's money, the VFA and / or private cryptographic keys;
  • The custodian or local services just for the activity of such VFA exchange

A Licensing process

A VFA Services license application can only be made by an approved VFA agent.

Step 1: Submit a letter of intent to the MFSA including:

  • Description of the proposed structure
  • VFA service for which a license is requested
  • Identication of persons holding key positions
  • A Legal opinion that the proposed activity is not subject to the legislation on traditional financial services

Step 2: Participation in the compulsory pre-meeting at the MFSA offices

Step 3: Submit the application, the annexed documents to the commission within 60 days from the preliminary meeting
Once the documentation / information and assessment of propriety and correct qualifications meet the requirements, the MFSA issues an “official approval” valid for 3 months, during which the incomplete issues must be resolved

Step 4: The final license is issued

Step 5: It is necessary to start a business within 12 months from the date the license is issued

Requirements for a license
  • The application form must be completed and submitted
  • All documentation, required by the MFSA, must be completed and submitted, including a business plan, policies and procedures related to administration, compliance with the rules, risk management, security access systems and protocols, financial resources, capital adequacy, professional compensation insurance and any other documents, requested by the MFSA
  • The documents of a total legal expertise of the company must be submitted and the person, who owns and operates the company should be present
  • The company must be registered in Malta. If it is not registered in Malta, it must be incorporated into a recognized jurisdiction, provided that a branch is also established in Malta and meet all the requirements, set by the MFSA
  • The company must be managed by at least two individuals for a "dual control"
  • The company facilities must be limited to run as a license holder, providing the VFA services – the company cannot carry out any other activity that is licensed by another law
  • Payment of duties

All licensees will be posted on a public online registry.

The license holder should start to provide the authorized services within 12 months from the date a license was issued, otherwise a license will be canceled.

Suitability and quality assessment

The suitability and quality assessment applies to:

  • The persons, holding at least 10% of direct / indirect interest in the company
  • Voluntary owners
  • Board members
  • A Senior manager
  • The MLRO – must be a BoA member or a compliance officer
  • A Compliance Officer (Compliance function can be performed by a VFA agent) – can also act as the MLRO
  • A Risk manager (if it is relevant)
  • Anyone else who runs a VFA business effectively

He must represent the PQ and have an appropriate level of qualifications, professional knowledge and experience. It is also necessary to prove that you spend enough time for the proper execution of activity.

Registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic

Registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic. A cryptocurrency is a digital currency, controlled by the cryptographic methods (an international electronic money, created on the base of a data encryption).

A fiat is a traditional currency (dollar, euro, pound) that has a physical shape in the form of banknotes and coins. Benefits: Officially recognized currency, exchangeable at a fixed equivalent. Disadvantages: Less protected from the decentralization factors, compared to a cryptocurrency. It is controled from the states.

The earned crypto money is stored on the blockchain, an encrypted chain of the algorithms, that is divided into blocks, and stored on several computers at the same time. The principle of operation is similar to the files download programs, i.e. torrent.

For the last years, the popularity and demand for cryptocurrencies has caused a growing interest in the crypto industry. In order to establish the companies in this area, a crypto exchange / crypto wallet / ICO, a license is required.

The Czech Republic is one of the European countries with the advanced economic and political trends. Here you can easily pay for any goods and services with cryptocurrency – food, housing, clothing, leisure, etc.

The validity period is one year. It is followed by opening an account for a business, recruiting the employees, purchasing the software and technical equipment.

At the last stages of registration, you need to have a complete package of company's documents, pay the state fee and submit the gathered documents to the proper state authorities.

The Czech government's opinion about the crypto business in the Czech Republic

The Czech laws considers the digital currency not as a monetary unit, but as a product. A crypto business in the Czech Republic does not need a license, but it is possible to obtain a license for the international work with cryptocurrency – the EMI.

Digital money is not subject to special taxes, but the VAT is charged on payments with cryptocurrency. Otherwise, a legal entity – the customer should pay the value added tax instead of his supplier.

The Czech National Bank opinion about the cryptocurrency and related activities

The CNB says that bitcoin is not a cashless currency. Accordingly, a cryptocurrency is a symbolic money that does not have a fixed value, in contrast to the officially recognized currencies.

The bitcoins exchange is not a currency one, therefore, the CNB does not control the activities with cryptocurrency.

The head of the currency control department of the CNB expressed the concern that the bitcoin will become a tool to bypass payment sanctions for online games. Therefore, the Ministry of Finance was asked to modernize the regulation about the control of gambling.

What should be born in mind for registering the cryptocurrency activities in the Czech Republic?

With the high popularity and extensive use of cryptocurrency, it is not under the jurisdiction of the state. Moreover, the CNB imposed a ban on opening an account for crypto exchangers and crypto exchanges.

Therefore, it is necessary to open the cryptocurrency accounts for companies outside the Czech Republic, in another jurisdiction.

It is important to take into account the requirements of the Czech Ministry of Finance, according to which the cryptocurrency activities are impossible without verification of the identity of each participant in this process.

The law obliges the sellers and buyers of a cryptocurrency in the Czech Republic to comply with the KYC and AMI standards strictly.

The requirements are caused by the fear of the state about the number of the tax evaders, fraudulent activities in the field of finance and a terrorism.

Options of Solution – registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic

An alternative option for a crypto exchanger / crypto exchange registration is other countries with more progressive terms.
For example:

  • The UK – the cryptocurrency legislation have not been amended yet, but the state does not hinder a crypto activity in all forms. It is possible to withdraw the digital money into fiat money.
  • Estonia – issues licenses for all existing operations with cryptocurrency.
  • Malta – 3 regulations were recently adopted: on virtual financial assets, on innovative technologies and services, and on digital innovation operations (The Virtual Financial Assets Act, the VFA; The Innovative Technology Arrangements and Services Act; The Malta Digital Innovation Authority Act. the MDIA).
  • Luxembourg – issues the EMI licenses, that include all the ability for cryptocurrencies operations.
  • Switzerland – depending on the project, it issues a license either the FINMA or the SRO.
  • Belarus – issues licenses for crypto activities, but asks not to withdraw funds outside the country.

The Japanese crypto business is considered to be the leading and most expensive in terms of the number of government exchanges. An American license is specific and concretized for each separate type of activity with the digital money.

License for a cryptocurrency company in Switzerland

License for a cryptocurrency company in Switzerland. Switzerland is considered the world leader in financial transactions and operations.

The country's leadership pays attention to the legislation reforming, based on the situation with the development of the cryptocurrency business and blockchain. The non-fiat currencies got a legal status in 2014.

Cryptocurrencies have been recognized as a digital form of value, such a monetary value can be bought and sold through the Internet channels. This event was recorded in the report of the Federal Council of the country. So, cryptocurrencies were officially recognized as the assets.

It became the basis for the online money industry licensing. The first license was issued in 2017. The exchanger received the status of an intermediary (DSFI), that gave it the right to serve the qualified investors.

لاw, the crypto exchangers and ICOs have the opportunity to pool funds. The functional responsibilities of the FINMA regulator have also been expanded.

It monitors the activities of organizations whose work is related to the non-fiat funds, warns the possible risks, prevents the emergence of the unauthorized business models, and fights the fraud.

Legalization of the crypto business is carried out by the Financial Market Supervisory Authority. The relevant amendments were also made to the Banking Regulations. The government regulation in the field of online currencies reached a new level in 2018.

The State Secretariat for International Finance has created a working group for direct cooperation with the FINMA. Due to the new rules, firms that use the blockchain and exchange technologies on a small scale will not be verified by the official bodies.

The exchanges that are not licensed to conduct the cryptocurrency transactions must comply with the generally accepted regulations.

Responsibilities of the Swiss exchangers

Companies that conduct the ICO operations, cryptocurrency trading in any form, should work according to the established rules. The company must:

  • fight against a money laundering: the legal entities dealing with deposit assets must follow this law – an identity verification and authentication of the buyer and sender of funds are required;
  • discourage the terrorism and comply with all accepted CFT rules;
  • ensure the complete safety of client funds in order to be credible – this is prescribed by the European KYC regulations;
  • conduct a correct tax policy – crypto funds are considered as a foreign currency. Obtaining a license to conduct transactions with non-fiat funds implies a timely payment of taxes on a general basis. The capital gains are not taxed.
